(Long Post, hope you can stick through it.)

::Cerberus::

    He had been =
on his way back to the Sulaco when he had heard fighting begin, but he had =
no time for it, a Dark Master called upon him. Nearing his birth place he s=
tood, awaiting, the air seemed thick with something he could not describe. =
The ground around him shook with forces of Heaven, or was it Hell? He groun=
d gave way below him and he plunged. For what seemed like an eternity he fe=
ll, until he hit the ground, his left arm was mangeled and needed repair ba=
dly.
    Something forced him to his feet and towards what seemed to be a m=
assive sarcofigus. The lid opened and out streached a clawed, pale, mangled=
 hand. It beconded him. Cerberus could not refuse. He came forward and knee=
led before the waiting hand. The walls around the coffin glowed with an unn=
atural red, almost crimson. Then the body within the coffin spoke.
    "Gre=
etings, Cerberus," It said, all that could be seen was the hand and red eye=
s. "I bid thee welcome."
    "Who, what are you?" Cerberus spoke back.
    =
"I am impressed, lesser beings could not even speak in my presence. I am Vu=
kodlak, Sculptor of the bodys of thousands. I am Vivode Decpticon, I am you=
r new master."
    "I will not serve a monster," He said.
    "Then suppose=
 I gave you your beloved Magmatron's head on a pike?" Vivode Vukodlak said.=

    "It is tempting, but," He said. But he could resist no longer, he took=
 the hand and bit into it, drinking Vukodlak's Mech Fluid. He became a Prem=
ysl Revenant, servant to this Vivode master.
    While Vukodlak slept, Cerb=
erus would do whatever was nessary to bring about his masters resurection.
=
    He left, heading towards the Sulaco, with a evil green glow in his eyes=
...
